labels.text: These two works dissect the daily actions of dressing and undressing and laughing into sequential steps. They offer a rational, non-expressive approach to human behaviour at a time when the passions and idealism of the 85 New Wave were at their height. Rather than use oil paint, Geng Jianyi experimented with a conceptual method of cutting and pasting paper photocopies onto wooden boards.

These two works dissect the daily actions of dressing, undressing, and laughing into sequential steps. They offer a rational, non-expressive approach to human behaviour at a time when the passions and idealism of the ’85 New Wave were at their height. Geng here abandoned oil paint and experimented with a conceptual method of cutting and pasting paper photocopies onto wooden boards.
兩件作品分別將穿衣、脫衣及笑的行為解構成連續步驟。在「八五新潮」的激情及理想主義發展到高潮時，作品為人類行為提供了一種理性的、非表現性的手法。耿建翌摒棄了油彩，開始以剪貼影印圖像及木板拼貼進行實驗概念創作。

title.en: Two Series of Fives Steps of Wearing Clothes

medium.zh-hant: 剪貼影印圖像、拼貼、木板

images.AltText: Photocopied collage on wood. Next to the words ‘Wear a Jacket: Five Beats’ is a row of five photocopies depicting a man donning a jacket. In the second row, beside the words ‘Take Off a Sweater: Five Beats’, the man takes off his sweater. Each step is accompanied by a remark such as “Don’t pull on your shirt too hard’.
images.AltTextTC: 影印圖像木板拼貼。其上半部分顯示着「外套：一個五拍」的字樣，旁邊是一排五張影印圖像，展現一個男人穿上外套的過程。木板下半部分顯示着「脫毛衣：一個五拍」的字樣，旁邊圖像是一個男人脫去外套的五個步驟。每一步都附設註解，例如是「不要硬拉和用力過猛」。
